quest.name: Water Palaver
journal:
î‚¾ Quest Sync
Ghon Gon is waiting impatiently for his nephew to return.
objectives: Give the gnawed water bottle to Ghon Gon's nephew.

dialogue.name: GHONGON
dialogue.text: Where is that nephew of mine? I sent him to Twine on an errand a while ago, and he has still not returned!

dialogue.name: GHONGON
dialogue.text: If your travels happen to take you that way, could you keep an eye out for him?

dialogue.name: GHONGON
dialogue.text: <sigh> Knowing him, he probably forgot to take any water and is lying in a ditch somewhere...

dialogue.name: GHONGON
dialogue.text: Hmm... Perhaps you should take this, just in case. If he is thirsty, give him some to drink. And if he is sleeping, pour it on his head to wake him up!

dialogue.name: GHONGON
dialogue.text: I knew it was a mistake to send that boy by himself. Where could he be?

dialogue.name: MORDERRAND03488
dialogue.text: Why does this desert...have to be so...dry? Never been so...thirsty...

dialogue.name: GHONGON
dialogue.text: You found him!? Did you give him the water, like I asked?

dialogue.name: MORDERRAND03488
dialogue.text: You have saved me from certain death! Well, extreme thirst, at the very least! But how did you know?

dialogue.name: MORDERRAND03488
dialogue.text: I just wanted to make him proud, to show my gratitude to him for raising me. But all I do is cause problems.

dialogue.name: MORDERRAND03488
dialogue.text: No point moping about it, though! I'll have to do better next time. Thank you for the water, it was much appreciated!

dialogue.name: GHONGON
dialogue.text: My nephew made it back alive! I was so relieved to see him!

dialogue.name: GHONGON
dialogue.text: I only sent him to deliver some smoked lizard meat, but I had no idea it would end like this!

dialogue.name: GHONGON
dialogue.text: Still, it is important for both Garik and Twine to send these kinds of supplies back and forth.

dialogue.name: GHONGON
dialogue.text: I wish we still had a Talos. Then my nephew would not have to go on such dangerous trips.

dialogue.name: GHONGON
dialogue.text: He might be a fool, but he is a good boy at heart. Thank you for helping him return safely!
